projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.

projects.name: SURE: Speedier Simulations
projects.summary: Quasi-Monte Carlo methods are used in numerical simulations when dealing with random variables. In this REU project, I explored the use of these methods on estimating the density of functions of many random variables, an idea that is widely applicable across many industries. I also tested these methods in Python, working in and on the QMCPy repository.
highlights: Investigated low discrepancy sequences and their application to kernel density estimation
Researched and implemented quasi-Monte Carlo density estimation with conditioning into QMCPy
Presented research biweekly for other students and faculty utilizing LaTeX and Beamer
